benchmark_details.name: Token-by-Token Regeneration and Domain Biases: A Benchmark of LLMs on Advanced Mathematical Problem-Solving
benchmark_details.overview: This study evaluates 10 language models on 945 competition-level mathematics problems, focusing on their ability to generate executable Python code. The findings reveal a performance gap between the most and least effective models, along with implications for using token-by-token regeneration in enhancing model outputs.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To benchmark 10 LLMs on competition-level mathematics problems and identify performance gaps and areas for improvement.

data.source: The MATH dataset, a publicly available collection of 12,500 competition-level mathematics problems.

methodology.calculation: Weighted accuracy calculated as the percentage of answers scoring 4 or 5 across the dataset.
methodology.interpretation: Performance is assessed based on a 5-point scale for accuracy, where higher scores reflect better correctness.
methodology.baseline_results: The gpt-4o-mini-2024-07-18 achieved an accuracy of 83.7% while open-codestral-mamba:v0.1 scored 49.2%.
methodology.validation: The evaluation was conducted using a dedicated high-performance model for assessing response correctness.
